column4: after changing cloned mac address to connect to a wifi network it never connects,  connects fine with the box left empty though... i keep getting deauthenticated according to dmesg
is there mac filtering enabled on the wifi network?
no
So everything is working then?
everything works fine until I put a different mac in the cloned box
then it doesn't connect, it just sits there, gets auth and after a while a deauth.
why change the MAC address?
there is another network i need to access but has mac filtering
if i can't get it working here i can't get it working there
when you do a ifconfig, does it show that MAC ?
yes, when i put in the cloned one, while connecting it has the new one
i keep getting de--authed while connecting
If the MAC shows correct with ifconfig, then I'm not sure what's going on with the auth on the wifi side.
it worked fine before i upgraded to 11.10
was working on 10.10
I'm not sure what changed between the versions to make it work.  I'd say a driver issue, but I believe you stated that it works fine if you don't clone the MAC.
correct
so yea I don't think that's a driver issue then, most home routers aren't going to provide much useful information as to what's going on that side either =\
that's why I came here
it's happening on linux mint 12 and ubuntu 11.10
works find on linux mint 10
yea not sure what changed between the versions, sorry
